com.madisp.stupid.context

Class DefaultConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.madisp.stupid.context.DefaultConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter

    public class DefaultConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Converter
    The default (and pretty stupid) type coercion rules for stupid.

    • Method Detail

      • toBool

        public boolean toBool(java.lang.Object value)
        Converts an object to bool. Returns true if the argument is not null and one of the following is true:
        1. value is of type Boolean and value.booleanValue() returns true
        2. value is of type String and value.length() is larger than zero
        3. value is of type Integer and value.intValue() is not zero
        4. value is of type Long and value.intValue() is not zero
        Specified by:
        toBool in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        boolean representation of the value

      • toInt

        public int toInt(java.lang.Object value)
        Converts something to an integer. If the argument is of type Integer then the intValue is returned. If the argument is of type Float, Double or Long then it is truncated/converted to an int (with possible data loss in the process). In all other cases 0 is returned.
        Specified by:
        toInt in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        int representation of the value

      • toDouble

        public double toDouble(java.lang.Object value)
        Converts the argument to a double-precision value. If the argument is of type Double then the double is returned. If the argument is of type Float, Integer or Long then it is truncated/converted to a double (with possible data loss in the process). In all other cases 0.0d is returned.
        Specified by:
        toDouble in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        double representation of the value

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object value)
        Returns the string representation of an object
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        "null" if value is null, value.toString() otherwise
